mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Clarysville Hospital. Civil War Records of Samuel West, Physician
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Patient Record for Ellswick, William F.
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: Rock Camp, Lawrence Co., Ohio [Rock Camp, Lawrence County, Ohio]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Patient Name: Ellswick, William F. Patient Age: 24. Marital Status: Single. Diagnosis: Gun shot fracture of left hand. Musket ball entered palm passing upward and outward and exit between carpal extremity of middle and ring fingers. Location Wounded: Winchester, Va [Kernstown, Va]. Date Wounded: 1864/07/24. Nature of Wound: Musket ball. Treatment: Cold water dressings by irrigation. Erysipelas in wound and hand. Line iodine 3 or 4 times per day and whyskey 4 times per day full diet . Result: Wound doing well when tranfered to US Genl Hospital, Parkersburg, VA [West Virginia] 1864/09/27.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Ellswick, William F.
Gun shot fracture of left hand. Musket ball entered palm passing upward and outward and exit between carpal extremity of middle and ring fingers
